intro: Jussiaea lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of ponds. Jussiaea lanceolata is typically perennial and has a low-growing habit with a fibrous root system.
